sn35.160:1.1: This monastery belonged to the Buddha’s doctor, Jīvaka, who appears in DN 2. His story is told in Kd 8, where we learn that he was raised by Prince Abhaya of Magadha, a Jain (MN 58) who was also interested in the teachings of Pūraṇa Kassapa (SN 46.56). MN 55 on eating meat is addressed to him. | This discourse and the next are similar to SN 22.5–6.
